result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roland P.G. Messier Jr.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 9:08am 
Defendant Roland P.G. Messier Jr. in court with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance. 
Both counsel indicate they have received and reviewed the report regarding the status of the restoration to competency programming. Both indicate they are in agreement with the continued finding that Mr. Messier is incompetent.  
The Court finds that Mr. Messier currently remains incompetent to proceed.  
recess 9:12am

NEXT:  Status Conference (re status of restoration of competency) on November 11th at 8:30am-- JA note in comments that case is at prelim stage
OCRP Admission Decision
Bond payment information
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
to Adjourn
to Adjourn
Status conference on June 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
ec/pc: DA, Atty Nelson, DHS/MMHI, JESO (5/6/22--ma)

[MK] case called 3:33pm 
Defendant Roland P.G. Messier Jr. in court, in custody, with Attorney Cassi Nelson. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Nelson indicates that she has reviewed the competency examiner's report with Mr. Messier, and they are in agreement that Mr. Messier is not currently competent, but with treatment he is likely to become competent.  
ADA Shock indicates that the State is in agreement with Dr. Schoenecker's findings.  
The Court finds that Mr. Messier is incompetent to proceed at this time, but if provided with treatment, it is likely he will become competent.  The Court suspends the proceedings.  The Court directs that the clerk will draft the order.  [clerk's inserted note:  post hearing the CR-206 Order of Commitment for Treatment is drafted and signed by the Court]. 
As to the Defendant 4/22/22 Motion for Modification of Bond:  after hearing arguments from counsel , the Court denies the Motion.
recess 3:43pm. 

NEXT:  Status Conference (re status of the restoration of competency) on June 17th at 2:00pm--JA please note in calendar comments that case is at prelim stage
State's Notice of Motion for Modification of Bond with date entered by JA
Defendant's
Court's Response to Defendant's 3/31/22 Motion for Bond Modification: Ex Parte- No Action.
Defendants Motion for Bail/Bond Modification
Competency hearing on May 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

[ml] Case called at 3:00PM
Defendant Roland P.G. Messier Jr. in court with attorney Cassi Nelson. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Hall verifies Victim Rights Compliance.
This hearing is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing, however Att Nelson raises the issue of competency.

The Court orders the Defendant to have a competency examination, and sets this matter over for a Competency Hearing.

recess 3:02PM

NEXT: Competency Hearing on 05/05 at 3:30PM
ec - Counsel; email - WCS with Complaint and cc - JCSD.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on March 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 1:50pm 
Defendant Roland P.G. Messier Jr. appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Nelson provides an updated address for Mr. Messier in Ixonia.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit, as requested by the Defense. 
The Court requires a $5,000 Cash Bond with conditions:
--absolutely no contact with the Victim 1
--no unsupervised contact with any minor, with the exception that Mr. Messier may have contact with his own children as per Court Orders 
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin 
recess 2:03pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on March 28th at 2:30pm

ADDRESS INFO for Roland P.G. Messier Jr.
Current: 1634 W. Rockvale Rd., Ixonia, WI 53036 United States  (Effective: 03-18-2022)
Prior: 900 Grove Street, #1, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538
